summary: This document contains notes from a November 28, 2021 meeting, likely involving legal or expert preparation. It discusses academic literature comparing the grooming and entrapment tactics used by child sex traffickers to those described in childhood sexual abuse literature, and references preparation for trial testimony and a prior Daubert hearing.

persons.name: Rocchio
persons.context: Participant in the meeting where literature on trafficking and childhood sexual abuse tactics is discussed. Likely an expert or consultant.

persons.name: Winters
persons.context: Authored or is associated with a recent comprehensive literature review on sex trafficking, which is cited in the meeting notes.

events.title: Meeting on Trafficking and Abuse Literature
events.description: A meeting was held to discuss academic literature comparing the grooming/entrapment tactics of child sex traffickers to those used in childhood sexual abuse, and to prepare for trial testimony.

events.title: Prior Daubert Hearing
events.description: A Daubert hearing (a hearing on the admissibility of expert testimony) was held prior to this meeting, and testimony from it was previously provided.

keyFacts: The document notes that strategies used by traffickers to entrap and control victims are nearly identical to the 'grooming' techniques described in childhood sexual abuse literature.

A recent comprehensive literature review by 'Winters' found that tactics used by child sex traffickers to recruit minors and maintain compliance are similar to those in childhood sexual abuse literature.
The meeting involved preparation for upcoming trial testimony, indicating an active legal proceeding related to these topics.
The document references a statistical meta-analysis of risk factors for childhood sexual abuse, including child, parent, and family-related vulnerabilities.
